step1.sentence: I need to get a haircut before the wedding this weekend.

step2.story: Jake looked in the mirror and realized his hair was getting way too long. He decided to get a haircut after work at the barbershop down the street. When he walked out, he felt like a completely new person.

step3.story: Mina had been putting off visiting the salon for months because she was always too busy with work. One Saturday morning, she finally made an appointment to get a haircut at a place her friend had recommended. The stylist listened carefully and suggested a shorter style that would be easier to manage. When the haircut was done, Mina couldn't stop smiling at her reflection. She snapped a selfie and sent it to her friend with a thank-you message. From that day on, she promised herself she'd get a haircut regularly instead of waiting until it became a problem.

meaning.realUsageKo: 미용실이나 이발소에 가서 머리를 자르는 일상적인 행위를 표현할 때 사용합니다. 직접 자르는 것이 아니라 전문가에게 맡기는 뉘앙스가 포함되어 있습니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'get'은 '~을 받다/얻다'라는 의미이고, 'haircut'은 'hair(머리카락)'와 'cut(자르기)'의 합성어입니다. 누군가에게 서비스를 받는다는 의미의 'get + 명사' 구조입니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 일상적이고 가벼운 표현으로, 격식 없는 대화에서 자주 쓰입니다. 'I got a haircut'이라고 하면 최근에 머리를 잘랐다는 사실을 알리는 자연스러운 표현입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: You should get a haircut — it's getting really long.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 머리 좀 잘라야겠다 — 너무 길어지고 있어.
